inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Google Play service connection that is configured with your account credentials.

inputs.name: serviceAccountKey
inputs.label: JSON key path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The JSON file provided by Google Play that includes the service account's identity you wish to publish your APKs or AABs under.

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application id (com.google.MyApp)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application id of APK or AAB you want to release, e.g. com.company.MyApp. This is only required if you haven't specified any APKs or AABs associated with the application.

inputs.name: updateOnlyStoreListing
inputs.label: Update only store listing
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, the task will update the specified track and selected APK and AAB file(s) will be assigned to the related track. By selecting this option you can update only store listing.

inputs.name: bundleFile
inputs.label: Main bundle path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the main bundle file you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.aab_ to match the first AAB file, in any directory.

inputs.name: additionalBundles
inputs.label: Additional bundle path(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Paths to additional bundle files you want to publish to the specified track (e.g. an x86 build). Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.AAB_ to match all APK files, in any directory.

inputs.name: apkFile
inputs.label: Main APK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the main APK file you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match the first APK file, in any directory.

inputs.name: shouldPickObbFile
inputs.label: Upload OBB for main APK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to pick obb file for the main apk. If present in the parent directory, it will pick the first file with .obb extension, else it will pick from apk directory with expected format as main.<version code>.<package name>.obb

inputs.name: additionalApks
inputs.label: Additional APK path(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Paths to additional APK files you want to publish to the specified track (e.g. an x86 build). Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match all APK files, in any directory.

inputs.name: shouldPickObbFileForAdditonalApks
inputs.label: Upload OBBs for additional APKs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to pick obb file for the apk. If present in the parent directory, it will pick the first file with .obb extension, else it will pick from apk directory with expected format as main.<version code>.<package name>.obb

inputs.name: track
inputs.label: Track
inputs.helpMarkDown: Track you want to publish the APK to.

inputs.name: shouldAttachMetadata
inputs.label: Update metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to update the metadata on your app release.

inputs.name: changeLogFile
inputs.label: Release notes (file)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the file specifying the release notes (change log) for the APK you are publishing.

inputs.name: languageCode
inputs.label: Language code
inputs.helpMarkDown: An IETF language tag identifying the language of the release notes as specified in the BCP-47 document. Default value is _en-US_

inputs.name: metadataRootPath
inputs.label: Metadata root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the metadata folder with the fastlane metadata structure.

inputs.name: changeUpdatePriority
inputs.label: Set in-app update priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change the in-app update priority value.

inputs.name: updatePriority
inputs.label: In-app Update Priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set a custom in-app update priority value to help keep your app up-to-date on your usersΓÇÖ devices. To determine priority, Google Play uses an integer value between 0 and 5, with 0 being the default, and 5 being the highest priority. Priority can only be set when rolling out a new release, and cannot be changed later.

inputs.name: rolloutToUserFraction
inputs.label: Roll out release
inputs.helpMarkDown: Roll out the release to a percentage of users.

inputs.name: userFraction
inputs.label: Rollout fraction
inputs.helpMarkDown: The percentage of users the specified APK will be released to for the specified 'Track'. It can be increased later with the 'Google Play - Increase Rollout' task.

inputs.name: shouldUploadMappingFiles
inputs.label: Upload deobfuscation files (mapping.txt)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to attach your proguard mapping.txt files to your AABs/APKs.

inputs.name: mappingFilePaths
inputs.label: Deobfuscation paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: The paths to the proguard mapping.txt files to upload. Glob patterns are supported. If you want to specify mapping file for a specific version code, use this syntax: `$(VersionCode): /path/to/mapping.txt`. If you specify a path without version code, the corresponding version code will be picked up from aab/apk in this order: main aab, main apk, additional aabs, additional apks.

inputs.name: changesNotSentForReview
inputs.label: Send changes to review
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to send changes for review in GooglePlay Console. If changes're already sent for review automatically, you shouldn't select this option. [More info](https://developers.google.com/android-publisher/api-ref/rest/v3/edits/commit#query-parameters).

inputs.name: releaseName
inputs.label: Release name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The release name is only for use in Play Console and won't be visible to users. To make your release easier to identify, add a release name that's meaningful to you.

inputs.name: versionCodeFilterType
inputs.label: Replace version codes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify version codes to replace in the selected track with the new APKs: all, the comma separated list, or a regular expression pattern.

inputs.name: replaceList
inputs.label: Version code list
inputs.helpMarkDown: The comma separated list of APK version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment.

inputs.name: replaceExpression
inputs.label: Version code pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression pattern to select a list of APK version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment, e.g. _.\*12?(3|4)?5_
